supporting_spans: Kai-Koumou trembled with rage and his countenance was flushed with a fierce exultation.
Glenarvan hesitated, and watched the Maori chief very attentively.
reasoning: Evidence supports: These excerpts suggest that Kai-Koumou was a powerful and feared leader among his people, and that Glenarvan respected him enough to be intimidated by him.

analysis.claim_text: Captured at sixteen, he gnawed fish-bones to stay alive during months of imprisonment; on escape he inspired fellow captives by chewing burnt bone ash, then sneaked into a British merchant’s cabin, stole torn pages of an English dictionary and pieced together enough words for rough conversation.

sub_claims.text: Gnawed fish-bones to stay alive during months of imprisonment.
Inspired fellow captives by chewing burnt bone ash.
Sneaked into a British merchant’s cabin.
Stole torn pages of an English dictionary.

analysis.reasoning: Evidence supports: These excerpts suggest that Kai-Koumou was a powerful and feared leader among his people, and that Glenarvan respected him enough to be intimidated by him.
